name: Staniel Cay Yacht Club

reviews.title: SCYC - the best!!!
reviews.text: Hi All,

reviews.title: Things To Know
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Yacht Club on Staniel this past May (2005) and we could not have had a more different experience than those last two posts I read!

Yes, it is not a place for those who need to be pampered at the Four Seasons level, but we received fantastic service for our room, at the bar, in the dining room, with our skiff, with check-out...with everything! The staff were friendly and informative as well as available. We never had to ask twice for anything. Maybe the Yacht Club was understaffed for some reason when those other travelers were there - I hope they give it another chance. And, by the way, since our skiff sat only about 4 inches deep in the water, we weren't very worried about depths and such so the map provided by the Club was great. Of course, at times, everyone can be busy, and at this Yacht Club, the bar is the center of all activity so it can seem a bit hectic.
reviews.title: beautiful place, some issues to know about
SCYC is the base for a FABULOUS tropical vacation
reviews.text: Anyway, the surrounding waters are just unbelievable. I've never seen those blue-green colors before. Thunderball Grotto from the Bond movie is really cool as are the swimming pigs, the iguanas, the Land & Sea Park, and the many little beaches you can pull up to for privacy.

The food was fantastic. Period. I'm a big eater and I was happily satisfied at every meal. And my wife and I do NOT tend to eat the same things and we were both happy with the selections. The lobster was out-of-this-world! We had a great time meeting all sorts of different people during dinner and especially after at the bar. It can get a little loud on Fri and Sat, but that's what weekends are for and what we wanted! It was an absolute blast.
reviews.title: The Beach Less Traveled
Private oasis
reviews.text: Without reserve, one of the best times I've had on holiday. Went with the package plan and cannot beat the deal for whats included. The food is very good. But wait staff slightly lacking. If you remember you're on "island time", you may only long for a few more smiles from restaurant service. Otherwise, service from housekeeping, bar staff and management was friendly and competant. Having your own boat in which to explore Exuma Cays in all of their slpendor is remarkable. They'll pack your lunch for you and all you need to purchase is your alcoholic beverage of choice. I must mention, due to its remote location, the island of Staniel Cay charges about $65 for a case of beer. As we were a party of 2 couples, we stayed in the coral cottage, AKA "the big cottage". Accomodations were quaint and comfortable with the exception of Coral Cottages king beds,which are 2 twins connected to one another. Not included, which we payed extra for, was the golf cart rental which I recommend for island exploration , particularly Club Thunderball, and ability to travel to general stores. Overall, had a wonderful time and plan to return.

reviews.title: greatest place in the world
reviews.text: We went for a wedding, it's our favorite place of all times,been to many islands,

reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever!
reviews.text: this is the best place to vacation

reviews.title: Awesome - We will be back every year
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Staniel after a week's stay. I can't say enough about the clear waters, great snorkeling,friendly staff (esp. Rhonda!) and commaradarie we found at Staniel Cay. Been all over the Carribean and this place has the most beautiful waters and gorgeous beaches! There are deserted beaches everywhere you look. Did miss the television a bit for weather updates but yacht club has WiFi and TV in restaurant/ bar area. Wonderful food! The best lamb and lobster in the world. Food is much better then expected for small island with very little incoming transportation. Flew direct from Chicago to Nassau on AA and then Flamingo to Staniel. Flamingo was delayed outbound but very nice pilots and planes are not that small-planes have double engines, not just one propeller in front. Might stay at Sampson's next, but will return to eat at Staniel! Thanks Rhonda, Rita, Carl, Dave and LeAnn!

reviews.title: We loved SCYC!
reviews.text: Michael and Colette Musson 8/17-8/23/07

My husband and I stayed at SCYC for 4 nights in June '08 and we loved it. We did the all-inclusive plan which included the food, non-alcoholic drinks, a 13 ft boston whaler with fuel, bikes and snorkeling gear.
reviews.title: For us, it was paradise
Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: GETTING THERE: We flew Watermakers Air from the Ft. Lauderdale Executive Airport. Taking this shared charter service is definitely worth the extra money. We avoided Nassau! Both flights went smoothly. The flight to Staniel Cay lasted about 2 1/2 hours. We stopped in Congo Town (Andros Island, Bahamas) for immigration and customs. The return flight lasted 1 hour and 45 minutes with no stops. We went through U.S. Customs at the Ft. Lauderdale Executive Airport. It's a little room with 2 agents and just us and the 6 other passengers. We've never been through U.S. Customs so quickly! It was GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: COTTAGE: We were in the Orange cottage which was tiny! I couldn't even take a picture of the bathroom because it was so tiny! To be perfectly honest, the accommodations are basic. The cottage has AC, a small fridge, and a hairdryer. No TV (heaven). Anyway, one doesn't go there to spend time in a cottage. The GREAT feature of the cottage is the porch. OMG. It is HEAVEN. It's almost over the water and you can lay on your lounge chair for hours and stare at the unbelievably beautiful water, watch the boats go by, the nurse sharks and rays swim by while a constant breeze is being felt. Bring a good book and your iPod. PARADISE.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and casual atmosphere.
likes.disliked: — The 7:30 seating. It was just odd. That was the only time we had a set time to eat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: Breakfast was served between 8am-10am. You can get all your standard breakfast food. We only tried the eggs and the pancakes. Before serving you what you ordered, they do bring you a wonderful piece of fresh fruit like orange, grapefruit, honeydew, and cantaloupe. Breakfast was always very good.
reviews.title: one of our best vacations ever

likes.liked: — to have the boat to check out all the islands and beaches
likes.disliked: — smaller cottages are due for some renovations

reviews.text: Lunch and appetizer menus are available 11:30am till 9pm. You can get salads and fish or meat sandwiches. We tried the cheeseburger (okay), the tuna sandwich (very good) and the BLT (very good). We didn't see/try anything from the appetizer menu. They also offer boxed picnic lunches if you want to spend the day out on the boat. It consists of 1 sandwich/person, 1 small pringles/person, 1 small canned fruit/person and 1 drink/person.
reviews.title: Not great
Loose accounting, but still incredibly relaxing
reviews.text: A friend and I just spent three nights at SCYC, a trip which we planned at the last minute a week before. Given that we hadn't really put a lot of research into the trip, we would have been happy with anything, but it turned out to be a fabulous trip. SCYC is such a laid-back environment, and in such a fantastically beautiful setting, that you just don't care about the lackluster decor of the room or the weird shower door that won't close. Seriously, if you're upset about that kind of stuff in the room, you're clearly missing the point of the vacation - it's not about the room, or even the club, as much as the scattering of amazing beaches everywhere and the days spent trolling around on your Boston Whaler ($60/day) looking for the perfect spot to have your box lunch (sandwich, fruit cup, pringles).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of warnings - first, check your bill carefully, and make sure to read the details of whatever package you get (we had MAP, but thought we had All Inclusive - yikes). We got over/undercharged like crazy, and only after privately calculating the bill with my friend (and realizing that they had left off as many charges as they'd tacked on) did we settle the bill. And I'm not sure if the website says this, but there's a 5% charge for credit card use, and no ATM on the island, although they do accept personal checks (we were told too late to do anything about it).
reviews.title: Fantastic - great value for money

likes.liked: — Great base for exploring the Bahamas and good value for money
likes.disliked: — Mosquitos (but not seen there in such numbers before)

reviews.title: Great, Great, Great!!!
reviews.text: Also - for single female travelers, the SCYC bar can be kind of overwhelming. At all hours, it's full of mostly male yachters and boat crew, as well as locals, and my friend said it reminded her of Jimmy Buffet's song "Fins" ("Fins to the left, fins to the right, and you're the only bait in town"). One night we felt so uncomfortable that we snuck around the back of the bar to get out so we wouldn't have to run the gauntlet of ogling seamen blocking the entrance. SCYC still felt very safe, though - the island and the club itself are too small and intimate for anyone to try anything. Not dangerous, just annoying.

reviews.title: Laid Back, Bring your FlipFlops
reviews.text: Overall, totally beautiful and laid-back, and a very good Bahamas deal for the money (assuming you don't get wildly overcharged for the bar/food tab, etc. - watch out). I'd like to go back with a bigger group for a longer stay.

reviews.title: Unique Piece of Paradise Untouched!
reviews.text: Third time I've been to this resort. The 2nd time for Christmas.

description: Soothe your body, mind and soul with small island charm. Let one of our beautifully decorated cottages be your relaxing home while in the Exumas. Your balcony will literally overhang the clearest waters in the world. Secluded beaches. Incredible SCUBA, snorkeling, fishing and kayaking. Delicious cuisine. Inviting pool and sundeck. Friendly island bar. Full-service marina and 3,000’ airstrip. "Watermakers Air" provides convenient flights to Staniel Cay.
